SuperSU now works better, allow it on all platform versions (fixes #85)

closes #85 https://github.com/guardianproject/lildebi/issues/85

recognize koush superuser when built from source

unless specified otherwise, koush superuser when built from source uses
'com.thirdparty.superuser' so it doesn't conflict with the Play store
version. for example, the latest stable android-x86 build (4.4-r1) uses
this package name for the built-in version, and LilDebi doesn't see it,
prompting the user to install superuser.

closes #142 https://github.com/guardianproject/lildebi/pull/142
update to latest cdebootstrap (0.6.4) in Debian/jessie
rename 'Delete All' script to be more appropriately named
update to latest version of 'android-permissions' package

include current Android Locale in Debian setup

This sets the language on the Debian install based on how the language is
set in Debian.  It will only generate the locales on install, but it will
always set the current locale in start-debian.sh.  If the current locale is
differen than the locale at install time, the user needs to manually gen
the current locale in Debian.

closes #140 https://github.com/guardianproject/lildebi/issues/140

add note about getting cdebootstrap package from snapshot.debian.org

Since we're using the most recent version, whenever it is updated, the
previous version disappears from the main archives.  Luckily, it can still
be found in snapshot.debian.org

download cdebootstrap from snapshot.debian.org in case the version gets bumped

snapsnot.debian.org keeps archived versions of old packages, while the
mirrors do not.  So if 0.6.5 gets released, then 0.6.4 will disappear from
the mirrors, but still be available on snapshot.debian.org

include cdebootstrap deb in git, in case this version disappears

For anyone who wants to verify that this is using the original, they can
rm the included .deb file, and it'll be downloaded again.
move loading of Install Log into AsyncTask

update to latest debian-archive-keyring (2014.3)

create `make verify-debian-packages` to check commited .debs

This adds a target to check the .deb files included in this git against
what is on the Debian mirrors.

download keyring from snapshot.debian.org in case the version gets bumped

snapsnot.debian.org keeps archived versions of old packages, while the
mirrors do not.  So if a new package gets released, then 2014.3 will
disappear from the mirrors, but still be available on snapshot.debian.org

set image file limit to 2GB since busybox isn't built with CONFIG_LFS

This is a temporary measure until busybox is built using CONFIG_LFS, then
it should no longer be the limiting factor.  Instead it'll be the 4GB FAT
limit.
